page.title: 17THE JOHN THOMPSON,INGLEBY
page.content: Standing on a slope above the River Trent at Ingleby is a public house called "The John Thomson Inn,"believed to be the only pub in the British Isles named after its owner and landlord.The original building is about 500 years old and was a farmhouse until 1969,when it was converted into a public house by John Thompson.It has a fine olde worlde atmosphere and a beautiful garden.People come from miles around to enjoy its facilities. Another attraction is the fact that there is a small brewery on the premises where beer(JTS) and larger(ATS)are brewed.About 11,500 litres of beer are brewed there annually.
